turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Pflugerville, Texas.
turn.2: Pfluger Park is along Gilleland Creek and is the site of the city's annual German festival, the Deutschen Pfest, held the third weekend in May.
turn.4: The park includes the Fallen Warrior Memorial, trails, a grove, playground, volleyball courts, basketball court, picnic areas and large shade trees.
turn.6: Pfluger Park is also used for music events and festivals.
turn.7: Is there a lake in the city?
turn.8: Lake Pflugerville is a 180-acre reservoir built to provide the citizens of Pflugerville with drinking water.
turn.9: Is the lake open for other activities?
turn.10: It is open for fishing, swimming, jogging, canoes, kayaks and wind surfing.
turn.11: What else is at the park?
turn.12: Lake Pflugerville Park includes a three-mile walking/jogging trail, playground, boat launch, pavilion and beach area.
